pageContext.claim: “A lot of people cheat with mail-in voting....It shouldn't be mail-in voting. It should be: You go to a booth and you proudly display yourself. You don't send it in the mail where people pick up -- all sorts of bad things can happen by the time they signed that, if they sign that -- if they signed that by the time it gets in and is tabulated.”
pageContext.analysis: Despite Trump's frequent assertions of voter fraud, electoral fraud of any form is very rare. In about two-thirds of states, voters can request a mail-in ballot without providing an excuse for not being able to vote in person on Election Day. Five states — Colorado, Hawaii, Oregon, Washington and Utah — now conduct their elections almost entirely by mail, according to the National Conference of State Legislatures. At least 21 other states have laws that allow certain smaller elections, such as school board contests, to be conducted by mail, with three states -- California, Nebraska and North Dakota -- permitting counties to opt into conducting all elections by mail. Trump himself votes by absentee ballot in Florida.
